curriculum_overview.progression_philosophy: Start with iconic breweries that listeners recognize, expand to regional champions, then deep-dive into craft innovators and American pioneers
curriculum_overview.source_note: All brewery topics are based on actual Tippsy sake catalog inventory - listeners can purchase featured sakes directly

topic_categories.description: Legendary breweries that have shaped sake history and are recognized worldwide

topics.title: Dassai: The Sake Revolution
topics.subtitle: How one brewery from rural Yamaguchi conquered the world
topics.narrativeHook: In the 1990s, a struggling brewery in rural Japan made a controversial decision: abandon everything traditional. The gamble created the world's most famous sake.

topics.title: Hakkaisan: Snow Country Masters
topics.subtitle: The Niigata giant that defined 'tanrei karakuchi'
topics.narrativeHook: Beneath Japan's heaviest snowfall lies a brewery that transformed its harsh winters into liquid gold. Hakkaisan didn't just adapt to snow country—they made it their superpower.
keyThemes: Tanrei karakuchi (light and dry) style pioneer

topics.title: Hakutsuru: The White Crane's Flight
topics.subtitle: 270 years of Nada tradition from Japan's largest sake producer
topics.narrativeHook: Before craft sake, before boutique breweries, there was Nada. And in Nada's heart, a white crane has been spreading its wings for nearly three centuries.

topics.title: Kubota: Niigata's Other Giant
topics.subtitle: Asahi-Shuzo's premium brand that redefined elegance
topics.narrativeHook: In 1985, Asahi-Shuzo made a bet: create a sake so refined it would redefine what premium meant. They named it after their original founder, Kubota. That bet paid off spectacularly.

topics.title: Ozeki: The Sake That Conquered America
topics.subtitle: How a 300-year-old brewery became California's sake pioneer
topics.narrativeHook: In 1979, while Japanese breweries looked inward, Ozeki looked west—all the way to California. They didn't just export sake; they started brewing it on American soil.

topics.title: Kikumasamune: 350 Years of Innovation
topics.subtitle: The Nada pioneer that keeps reinventing tradition
topics.narrativeHook: Three and a half centuries. That's how long Kikumasamune has been perfecting sake while the world changed around them. Their secret? Never stop experimenting.

topics.title: Kenbishi: Japan's Oldest Sake Brand
topics.subtitle: 500+ years of unbroken brewing heritage
topics.narrativeHook: When Kenbishi started brewing sake, Columbus hadn't reached America yet. Today, they still refuse to put grades on their bottles. Five centuries of confidence will do that.

topics.title: Senkin: The Young Rebels of Tochigi
topics.subtitle: Eleventh generation brothers rewriting sake's future
topics.narrativeHook: When the 11th generation took over Senkin, they threw out the playbook. Their motto? 'Sake should taste like where it's from.' The wine world calls it terroir. They call it revolution.

topics.title: Daishichi: Kimoto Purists
topics.subtitle: The Fukushima brewery that never abandoned tradition
topics.narrativeHook: When everyone else modernized with fast yeasts, Daishichi said no. Their commitment to the ancient kimoto method wasn't stubbornness—it was foresight.

topics.title: Suigei: The Drunken Whale
topics.subtitle: Kochi's bold brewery with the unforgettable name
topics.narrativeHook: In Kochi, they drink more sake per capita than anywhere else in Japan. And when they drink, they drink Suigei—the 'Drunken Whale.' There's a reason for that name.

topics.title: Otokoyama: Hokkaido's Northern Star
topics.subtitle: Brewing excellence at Japan's frozen frontier
topics.narrativeHook: Most sake is made in temperate Japan. Otokoyama chose the frozen north, where winter temperatures plunge below -20°C. That choice made them legends.

topics.title: Kizakura: Kyoto's Fushimi Treasure
topics.subtitle: The 'Yellow Cherry Blossom' of Japan's ancient capital
topics.narrativeHook: Fushimi has been brewing sake since samurai ruled Japan. Among its legendary breweries, the Yellow Cherry Blossom—Kizakura—blooms with approachable innovation.

topics.title: Niizawa: The Art of 7%
topics.subtitle: Pushing rice polishing to the absolute limit
topics.narrativeHook: What happens when you polish rice down to 7% of its original size? It takes 200 hours. Only one brewery in the world does it. This is their story.

topics.title: Tatenokawa: Yamagata's Rising Star
topics.subtitle: The brewery that put mountain rice on the map
topics.narrativeHook: Nestled where rivers flow from sacred mountains, Tatenokawa has been quietly building a reputation that's now impossible to ignore.

topics.title: Born: Dreams Do Come True
topics.subtitle: Fukui's master of aged sake elegance
topics.narrativeHook: They say good sake needs to rest. Born took that philosophy to heart, aging their finest bottles until they achieved something extraordinary.

perplexity: Born Dreams Come True sake review

topic_categories.description: Breweries that define their prefecture's sake identity

topics.title: Katsuyama: Sendai's Samurai Sake
topics.subtitle: The Date clan's official brewery still brewing for nobility
topics.narrativeHook: For centuries, only the powerful Date clan could drink this sake. Now you can too—but the standards haven't dropped one bit.

topics.title: Ichinokura: Miyagi's Gift to the World
topics.subtitle: The brewery that made Tohoku sake famous abroad
topics.narrativeHook: Ichinokura means 'number one storehouse.' Bold name. They've spent decades proving they deserve it.

topics.title: Okunomatsu: Fukushima's Phoenix
topics.subtitle: Rising from disaster to international acclaim
topics.narrativeHook: After 2011, the world wrote off Fukushima sake. Okunomatsu wrote back—with some of the best sake they'd ever made.

topics.title: Homare: Aizu's Pride
topics.subtitle: Where samurai spirit meets brewing excellence
topics.narrativeHook: Aizu was the last samurai stronghold. That fighting spirit lives on in their sake—bold, uncompromising, unforgettable.

topics.title: Kikusui: Niigata's Bold Spirit
topics.subtitle: The brewery that created 'funaguchi' culture
topics.narrativeHook: Before craft cans, before premixed drinks, Kikusui put fresh sake in aluminum and changed how Japan drinks.

topics.title: Shirataki: Joetsu Snow Magic
topics.subtitle: Another Niigata treasure from snow-buried mountains
topics.narrativeHook: When snow buries your brewery for months each year, you learn to embrace it. Shirataki turned their frozen isolation into sake perfection.

topics.title: Takagi: Juyondai's Mystique
topics.subtitle: The cult sake you can't find—and why it matters
topics.narrativeHook: Some sake is hard to find. Juyondai is nearly impossible. Behind the hype is a tiny brewery that changed what premium sake could be.

topics.title: Kamenoi: Kudoki Jozu's Seduction
topics.subtitle: The art of charming your palate
topics.narrativeHook: Kudoki Jozu translates to 'skilled at seduction.' It's not just a name—it's a promise.

topics.title: Nanbu Bijin: The Southern Beauty
topics.subtitle: Iwate's pride with international acclaim
topics.narrativeHook: They named their sake 'Southern Beauty' after the graceful women of old Nanbu province. The elegance carries through every sip.

topics.title: Asabiraki: Iwate's Morning Light
topics.subtitle: Where mountain water meets master craft
topics.narrativeHook: Asabiraki means 'dawn.' Each morning, this brewery begins another day of perfecting what they've done for over a century.

topics.title: Rokka: Aomori's Apple Country Secret
topics.subtitle: Brewing excellence where apples rule
topics.narrativeHook: Aomori is famous for apples, but Rokka proves the region's water and climate make exceptional sake too.

topics.title: Hachinohe: Mutsu Hassen's Eight
topics.subtitle: The northern tip brewery with cosmic ambitions
topics.narrativeHook: Mutsu Hassen means 'Eight Views of Mutsu.' Each sip is meant to reveal another dimension of their northern homeland.

topics.title: Asamai: Heaven's Door Opens
topics.subtitle: Akita's gateway to sake enlightenment
topics.narrativeHook: Amanoto means 'Heaven's Door.' In Japan's northernmost sake region, this brewery opens the gates to pure brewing bliss.

topics.title: Imanishi: Nara's Ancient Root
topics.subtitle: Where sake was born, tradition lives on
topics.narrativeHook: Nara is sake's birthplace. At Imanishi, they don't just remember that history—they brew it fresh every day.

topics.title: Konishi: Where Sake Met Science
topics.subtitle: The Nada innovator that never stopped experimenting
topics.narrativeHook: In 1550, Konishi started brewing. Five centuries later, they're still finding new ways to push boundaries.

topic_categories.description: Smaller breweries pushing boundaries and creating unique expressions

topics.title: Amabuki: Flower Power Revolution
topics.subtitle: The only brewery using flower yeasts
topics.narrativeHook: While every other brewery uses sake yeast, Amabuki went to the garden. Their flower yeasts create sakes unlike anything else on earth.

topics.title: Imada: Hiroshima's Hattanso Guardians
topics.subtitle: Saving a rice variety from extinction
topics.narrativeHook: When Hattanso rice nearly vanished, one woman brewer devoted her career to saving it. This is her story.

topics.title: Ippongi: Fukui's Comeback Kid
topics.subtitle: The small brewery with championship spirit
topics.narrativeHook: Small doesn't mean insignificant. Ippongi proves that heart and skill can outshine even the biggest producers.

topics.title: Chiyomusubi: Tottori's Sand Dune Spirit
topics.subtitle: Brewing excellence from Japan's desert coast
topics.narrativeHook: In the shadow of Japan's famous sand dunes, a brewery creates sake as unique as its landscape.

topics.title: Kikunosato: Tochigi's Hidden Gem
topics.subtitle: The small brewer with big ambitions
topics.narrativeHook: Not far from Tokyo, a tiny brewery is making some of the region's most exciting sake. Time to discover Kikunosato.

topics.title: Fuji Brewing: Yamagata's Eiko Legacy
topics.subtitle: Mountain water and meticulous craft
topics.narrativeHook: Named for Japan's sacred mountain, Eiko Fuji aspires to the same lofty heights in their sake.

topics.title: Tsuji Honten: Okayama's Gozenshu Legacy
topics.subtitle: Brewing for lords, accessible to all
topics.narrativeHook: Gozenshu means 'sake served before the lord.' That aristocratic pedigree now belongs to anyone who seeks it.

topics.title: Kamikokoro: Heart Above All
topics.subtitle: Okayama's passion-driven perfectionist
topics.narrativeHook: Kamikokoro translates to 'heart above.' Every bottle carries that emotional investment.

topics.title: Nakao: Hiroshima's Gentle Giant
topics.subtitle: Soft water, softer approach, stunning results
topics.narrativeHook: Hiroshima pioneered soft-water brewing. Nakao carries that legacy forward with quiet confidence.

topics.title: Sekiya: Aichi's Fermentation Masters
topics.subtitle: Where hatcho miso meets sake craft
topics.narrativeHook: In Aichi, fermentation is an art form. Sekiya applies that same mastery to sake.

topics.title: Izumibashi: Kanagawa's Farm-to-Bottle Pioneer
topics.subtitle: Growing their own rice, making their own future
topics.narrativeHook: Most breweries buy rice. Izumibashi grows it. That hands-on approach creates something special.

topics.title: Fukumitsuya: Kanazawa's Living Legend
topics.subtitle: 400 years in Japan's most beautiful city
topics.narrativeHook: Kanazawa survived WWII untouched. So did Fukumitsuya, preserving four centuries of brewing wisdom.

topics.title: Kurosawa: Nagano's Mountain Artisan
topics.subtitle: High altitude brewing with sky-high standards
topics.narrativeHook: Nagano's mountains demand resilience. Kurosawa's sake reflects that alpine determination.

topics.title: Shiraiwa: Toyama's Crystal Waters
topics.subtitle: Pure snowmelt, pure intention
topics.narrativeHook: Maboroshi means 'illusion.' But there's nothing illusory about the quality in every bottle.

topics.title: Kita: Shiga's Ambitious Newcomer
topics.subtitle: The brewery breathing new life into Lake Biwa country
topics.narrativeHook: Near Japan's largest lake, a young brewery is making waves with ambitious, modern sake.

topics.title: Higashiyama: Kyoto's Other Treasure
topics.subtitle: In Fushimi's shadow, crafting quiet excellence
topics.narrativeHook: Everyone knows Fushimi's giants. Higashiyama proves that Kyoto's smaller breweries deserve attention too.

topics.title: Nanbu: Fukui's Dual Tradition
topics.subtitle: Not to be confused with Nanbu Bijin—equally excellent
topics.narrativeHook: Two Nanbu breweries, different regions, both exceptional. Fukui's version crafts Hanagaki with local pride.

topics.title: Kiyashou: Mie's Kokyu Heritage
topics.subtitle: Where Ise shrine pilgrims have refreshed for centuries
topics.narrativeHook: Near Japan's holiest shrine, pilgrims have drunk Kokyu sake for generations. The spiritual connection runs deep.

topics.title: Toshimaya: Tokyo's Urban Brewery
topics.subtitle: Surviving and thriving in Japan's biggest city
topics.narrativeHook: Brewing sake in Tokyo seems impossible. Toshimaya has been doing it since the Edo period.

topic_categories.description: Breweries making sake outside Japan, proving the craft travels well

topics.title: Brooklyn Kura: New York State of Sake
topics.subtitle: America's urban craft sake movement
topics.narrativeHook: In a Williamsburg warehouse, two Americans are proving that great sake doesn't need a Japanese address.

topic_categories.description: Episodes exploring entire sake regions and their unique characteristics

topics.title: Niigata: The Tanrei Karakuchi Kingdom
topics.subtitle: How snow country defined modern sake
topics.narrativeHook: Niigata makes more sake than any other prefecture. Understanding why reveals sake's modern evolution.

topics.title: Nada: The Birthplace of Scale
topics.subtitle: Hyogo's brewing district that fed a nation
topics.narrativeHook: Before modern distribution, Nada's sake traveled by ship to Edo. That maritime heritage shaped Japan's drinking culture.

topics.title: Fushimi: Kyoto's Soft Water Secret
topics.subtitle: Where emperors drank and traditions formed
topics.narrativeHook: While Nada brewed for the masses, Fushimi brewed for the court. That elegant heritage persists today.

topics.title: Tohoku: The Frozen North's Gift
topics.subtitle: Six prefectures, endless discovery
topics.narrativeHook: Japan's northeast was once considered sake's frontier. Now it's the heartland of quality.

topics.title: Yamagata: The Connoisseur's Prefecture
topics.subtitle: Where cult sake and innovation collide
topics.narrativeHook: Yamagata breweries win more competitions per capita than anywhere else. There's a reason for that.

topics.title: Hiroshima: The Soft Water Revolution
topics.subtitle: How one discovery changed brewing forever
topics.narrativeHook: Everyone said soft water couldn't make good sake. Hiroshima proved everyone wrong.

topics.title: Hokuriku: Japan's Sake Coast
topics.subtitle: Ishikawa, Toyama, and Fukui's liquid treasures
topics.narrativeHook: Japan's Sea of Japan coast creates unique conditions. The sake reflects that maritime character.

topics.title: Shikoku: The Island Secret
topics.subtitle: Four prefectures, unlimited personality
topics.narrativeHook: Shikoku's isolation created distinct brewing traditions. Now the world is discovering what locals always knew.

topics.title: Kyushu: The Southern Frontier
topics.subtitle: Where sake meets shochu territory
topics.narrativeHook: In shochu country, sake breweries fight for attention. Those that survive make something special.

topics.title: Sake Beyond Japan
topics.subtitle: The global craft sake movement
topics.narrativeHook: From Brooklyn to Berlin, sake is going global. But can it retain its soul outside Japan?

topic_categories.description: Episodes exploring specific themes across multiple breweries

topics.title: The Kimoto Revival
topics.subtitle: Why ancient methods are trending again
topics.narrativeHook: For decades, kimoto was considered obsolete. Now it's the hottest trend in sake. What changed?

topics.title: Women Who Brew
topics.subtitle: Female toji breaking barriers
topics.narrativeHook: Sake brewing was once forbidden to women. Now they're leading some of Japan's most innovative breweries.

topics.title: After the Earthquake
topics.subtitle: Tohoku's sake resilience story
topics.narrativeHook: March 11, 2011 devastated Tohoku's sake industry. What happened next is a story of remarkable resilience.

topics.title: The Rice Whisperers
topics.subtitle: Breweries growing their own sake rice
topics.narrativeHook: Most breweries buy rice. Some grow it themselves. That choice changes everything.

topics.title: The Polishing Wars
topics.subtitle: How low can you go—and should you?
topics.narrativeHook: Some breweries polish rice to 7%. Others say that's wasteful. The debate reveals deep philosophical divides.

topics.title: Aging Gracefully
topics.subtitle: The koshu (aged sake) renaissance
topics.narrativeHook: Most sake is drunk young. But a quiet movement is proving that patience pays off in unexpected ways.

topics.title: Bubbles Rising
topics.subtitle: Sparkling sake's moment
topics.narrativeHook: Once dismissed as gimmicky, sparkling sake is now serious business. The bubbles tell a bigger story.

topics.title: The Export Revolution
topics.subtitle: How sake conquered the world
topics.narrativeHook: Japanese sake consumption is declining. But exports are booming. The future of sake might be abroad.

topics.title: Sacred Sake
topics.subtitle: Breweries and shrines—an ancient bond
topics.narrativeHook: Before sake was a beverage, it was an offering to the gods. That spiritual connection still shapes the industry.

topics.title: Generation Next
topics.subtitle: Young brewers reinventing tradition
topics.narrativeHook: As master brewers age out, their children and successors are asking: what should sake become?

scheduling.sequence_strategy: Alternate between Iconic/Regional/Craft/Thematic to maintain variety
scheduling.regional_deep_dives: Release one per month as a special feature
scheduling.thematic_specials: Release quarterly or tie to relevant events

production_notes.music_style: Traditional Japanese instruments, modern ambient blend
production_notes.interview_clips: Include when available from news sources

tippsy_integration.product_links: Each episode links to featured brewery products on Tippsy
tippsy_integration.availability_check: Verify product availability before featuring prominently
